title: Enacts into law major components of legislation which are necessary to implement the state fiscal plan for the 2011-2012 state fiscal year
summary: Amends the dormancy period of miscellaneous unclaimed property; amends provisions of the law relating to banking corporations; updates the tax classification of diesel motor fuel to be consistent with federal laws; amends part N of Chapter 61 of the laws of 2005 in relation to making permanent the disclosure and penalty provisions for transactions that present the potential for tax avoidance; relates to the empire zones program; directs that lottery prizes of more than six hundred dollars be credited against liability for any tax administered by the commissioner of taxation and finance; relates to extending investment tax credits; creates a credit against income tax for persons or entities investing in low-income housing; improves the effectiveness of the Excelsior jobs program; amends the tax law in relation to exempting from the franchise tax insurance corporations for town or county cooperative insurance corporations; conforms certain provisions of the insurance law, general municipal law and tax law to the federal Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act; makes technical corrections to the definition of E85 and extends the alternative fuels tax exemption for one year; amends section 11 of part ee of chapter 63 of the laws of 2000, amending the tax law and other laws relating to modifying the distribution of funds from the motor vehicle fuel excise tax, in relation to the distribution of motor vehicle fees; relates to restrictions on certain keno style lottery games; authorizes the division of the lottery to administer a program of free play allowance credits to players of video lottery games for the purpose of increasing revenues earned by the video lottery program; relates to the prize payout of certain instant lottery games; relates to prize payout in certain multi-jurisdictional lottery games; amends the tax law in relation to including multi-jurisdictional and out of state video lottery gaming in the definition of "video lottery gaming."; relates to licenses for simulcast facilities, sums relating to track simulcast, simulcast of out-of-state harness tracks and distribution of wagers.
